intro: Diplopterys schunkei, commonly known as the Amazonian yoco, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with a hard, woody coat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora and traditional medicine.
